_prev_prog_3.Description:
Prevention Program Description



As a vital element of the facility's Prevention Program, Claxton Cold Storage has implemented a Process Safety Management Program as mandated by OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.119.  Claxton has implemented strict preventive maintenance and operating procedures in compliance with the Process Safety Management program. Additionally, the facility has developed an Emergency Action Plan where the release of ammonia is specially covered in the plan and contains required actions tp take place in the event of an ammonia release.  As part of the facility's prevention programs, emergency and operational training is conducted for employees and new hires.  Accidental release prevention, training and awareness are reinforced annually, and as operations at the facility dictates.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
CLAXTON COLD STORAGE RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



A. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Policies



Claxton Cold Storage Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Policy is intended to fully comply with OSHA?s Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard, (29 CFR 1910.119) and EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP) Regulation, (40 CFR Part 68). 



The purpose of the accidental release prevention and emergency action program is to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of toxic substances as well as fires, explosions, and other types of catastrophic accidents. Overall, these programs prevent accidental fatalities, injuries and illnesses and avoid physical property damage.



B. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled



The Claxton Cold Storage facility operates a cold storage facility that provide cooling and freezing capabilities for the storage of a variety of frozen food products.



The only RMP regulated chemical handled by Claxton Cold Storage is anhydrous ammonia.  Anhydrous ammonia is used at the facility in the refrigeration system for cooling and freezing products.  The anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system is a closed loop system.  The ammonia is contained in various vessels, piping, condensers and evaporators used throughout the refrigeration system.  Since ammonia releases from this system could pose a risk of offsite public impact, and anhydrous ammonia is regulated under the OSHA PSM standard (29 CFR 1910.119), the refrigeration system is subject to the Program 3 requirements of EPA's Risk Management Program.



C. Accidental Release Prevention Program



The prevention program at Claxton Cold Storage consists of OSHA?s Process Safety Management Program, 29 CFR 1910.119.  The PSM program contains the following elements equivalent to the requirements of EPA's Risk Management Program:



Employee Participation               Process Safety Information

Process Hazard Analysis            Operating Procedures

Train

ing                                 Contractors

Pre-startup Safety Review           Mechanical Integrity

Hot Work Permit                        Management of Change

Incident Investigation              Emergency Action Plan

Compliance Audits                     Trade Secrets



 

D. Off Site Consequence Analysis



As stipulated in EPA guidelines, 40 CFR Part 68.25(b)(1) the Worst Case and Alternate Case release scenarios were calculated according to EPA criteria and the results are on file at the Claxton Cold Storage facility. 



E. Five-Year Accident History



There have been no reportable incidents involving anhydrous ammonia at the Claxton Cold Storage facility over the past five years.



F. Emergency Response Program



The Emergency Action Plan at Claxton Cold Storage states that the facility will call in local emergency personnel in the event of a significant ammonia release. The facility is included in the community Emergency Response Program coordinated by the 24-Hour Warning LEPC: GEMA; 404-635-7200.  The local Claxton Fire Department has visited the facility to review the process operations, safety systems and discussed emergency response coordination.



G. Planned Changes to Improve Safety



No changes to the ammonia refrigeration process are planned at this time.   However, the process will be subjected to regular process hazard analyses reviews for the purpose of identifying and implementing potential improvements. Facility personnel will also periodically review all potential opportunities to improve the safety of our personnel, the surrounding community, and the ammonia refrigeration process.
